newsitem.title: CHINA: China welcomes Bosnia polls, urges co-existence.
newsitem.headline: China welcomes Bosnia polls, urges co-existence.

text.p: China welcomed on Monday Bosnia's first post-war elections, saying it was an opportunity for stability and peace in the turbulent nation.

"We hope that parties involved will seize the opportunity, bury their hatchets, and co-exist peacefully in striving for peace, stability and development of the region," the Xinhua news agency quoted Foreign Ministry spokesman Shen Guofang as saying.

The elections had "brought new light to the realisation of peace and stability of the region, and signified that the peace process in Bosnia-Herzegovina has entered into a new and important stage", Shen said.
Beijing was concerned about developments in Bosnia and supported the peaceful resolution of ethnic strife there, Shen said.
Preliminary results from balloting for a three-person Bosnian presidency from Moslem, Serb and Croat communities as well as inter-ethnic parliaments are due later on Monday.
